data.title: Zac Poland ’23
data.meta_description: Coach Willsea is a native of Colorado and played basketball at Gateway High School, where he was a four-sport athlete. After graduating from the University of Wyoming, he returned home to teach and coach basketball . He has been coaching high school basketball in Colorado for over 20 years. Coach Willsea and his wife, Tanya, have three kids; Tavian '22 is 19, Isabelle is 16, and Domini is 14. Coach Willsea feels blessed to be at RJHS . Coaching for: JV I coach because… I enjoy building relationships with our players. I want to encourage and guide them to be better players, but more importantly, better men. I find it rewarding, and hope to give each player a memorable and terrific experience. Favorite memory from coaching at RJ: We have had so many wonderful coaches, players and families in our program. I am honored to be a part of it and building those relationships has enriched my life beyond words. It is truly a special place and being able to coach my oldest son was an absolute pleasure and a highlight in my career . My coaching philosophy Hard Work, Discipline, Integrity, and Class are my cornerstones. By teaching these qualities, I can better ensure the positive impact my players will have on the world around them. Favorite motivational quote: “Winners are not people who never fail. Winners are people who never quit .” Inspirational figure: My parents Favorite tv show: Mountain Men Favorite music / band: Imagine Dragons Favorite professional team: New York Knicks Favorite professional player: Danny Manning Favorite food: Fried Chicken Favorite dessert: Chocolate Chip Cookies What is your pre-game ritual: I like to calmly sit and just get lost in my thoughts .
data.text:
Next Article

COACH DAVE WILLSEA

Coach Willsea is a native of Colorado and played basketball at Gateway High School, where he was a four-sport athlete. After graduating from the University of Wyoming, he returned home to teach and coach basketball . He has been coaching high school basketball in Colorado for over 20 years. Coach Willsea and his wife, Tanya, have three kids; Tavian '22 is 19, Isabelle is 16, and Domini is 14. Coach Willsea feels blessed to be at RJHS . Coaching for: JV I coach because… I enjoy building relationships with our players. I want to encourage and guide them to be better players, but more importantly, better men. I find it rewarding, and hope to give each player a memorable and terrific experience. Favorite memory from coaching at RJ: We have had so many wonderful coaches, players and families in our program. I am honored to be a part of it and building those relationships has enriched my life beyond words. It is truly a special place and being able to coach my oldest son was an absolute pleasure and a highlight in my career . My coaching philosophy Hard Work, Discipline, Integrity, and Class are my cornerstones. By teaching these qualities, I can better ensure the positive impact my players will have on the world around them. Favorite motivational quote: “Winners are not people who never fail. Winners are people who never quit .” Inspirational figure: My parents Favorite tv show: Mountain Men Favorite music / band: Imagine Dragons Favorite professional team: New York Knicks Favorite professional player: Danny Manning Favorite food: Fried Chicken Favorite dessert: Chocolate Chip Cookies What is your pre-game ritual: I like to calmly sit and just get lost in my thoughts .

COACH BLAKE BUTTERLY

Coach Butterly was born and raised in Aurora, Colorado and attended Regis Jesuit and Bishop Machebeuf High School, where he played basketball and tennis for four years. After graduating from high school, he attended Colorado Mesa University and was a walk on to the tennis team . He transferred to University of Colorado-Colorado Springs where he pursued a degree in Business Administration and Sports Management . While at UCCS he was an undergraduate assistant for the men's basketball program won a RMAC championship with the program. After graduating, Coach Butterly moved back to Denver to work for the Colorado Rockies while coaching at Bishop Machebeuf. He then moved on to coach at Bear Creek Highschool, serving as the freshman and JV coach for the past six years. Coach Butterly is extremely excited to be at Regis Jesuit .

COACH BRAD DORAIS

Coach Dorais has been teaching and coaching for 28 years . This is his second year coaching at Regis Jesuit . He was varisty head coach for 13 years at Pagosa Springs, Mesa Ridge and Cherokee Trail when it opened in 2003-04 . He has also coached boys and girls tennis . Coach Dorais currently teaches math at Cherokee Trail, including IB. He is married to Kati, who has taught at Regis Jesuit for 19 years and they have three children: Morgan - 18, Joe - 16, Haley - 14, and Jackson - 8 . Coaching for: Freshman red I coach because ... I love watching the players grow, develop, and come together for something bigger than themselves. There are so many life lessons that basketball teaches that I am glad to be a part of it, and hopefully build life-long relationships with my players. Coaching philosophy: Get players to achieve more than they thought possible by having positive attitudes and great effort (the 2 things that they have control of), putting the goals of the team above their individual goals, and doing it all with great enthusiasm . Favorite motivational quote: “I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me . ” Inspirational figure: John Wooden Favorite tv show: The Wire Favorite band or music: Led Zeppelin or Frank Sinatra Favorite professional team: Denver Nuggets - but prefer college basketball Favorite professional player: Mugsy Bogues Favorite food: Smothered Burritos Favorite dessert: Ice cream Pregame ritual: A little quiet time

Coaching for: Freshman Red I coach because ... I love the game of basketball and helping our young men realize the potential. I believe that if I can help our young men here at Regis become not just better basketball players, but better men, then I have done what God is calling me to do . . Favorite motivational quote: "The most important thing is to try and inspire people so that they can be great in whatever they want to do ." - Kobe Bryant Inspirational figure: My parents Favorite tv show: The Big Bang Theory Favorite band or music: Jack Johnson Favorite professional team: Denver Broncos, Nuggets, Avalanche, Rockies Favorite professional player: Nikola Jokic/ Rafael Nadal Favorite food: Grilled Cheese Pregame ritual: I like to pray, sit and watch warmups, and write out my thoughts for my pregame speech the night before.
